qas.question: When did human populations begin using hunting-gathering?
What phase of human used subsistence strategies to find food?
When did Homo sapiens begin using subsistence gathering?
When did hunting-gathering begin to fade from use?
What began replacing hunting-gathering at the end of the Mesolithic period?
What remained the only mode of subsistence until the end of the Paleolithic period?
What was replaced only gradually with the spread of the Mesolithic Revolution?
The Neolithic Period ended how many years ago?
Which subsistence strategy started with the Neolithic Revolution?

context: <b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>Hunting and gathering<b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> was presumably the subsistence strategy employed by human societies beginning some <a0_0>1.8 million years ago<a0_0/>, by <a1_0>Homo erectus<a1_0/>, and from its appearance some <a2_0>0.2 million years ago<a2_0/> by Homo sapiens. It remained the only mode of subsistence until the end of the Mesolithic period some <a3_0><b7_0>10,000<b7_0/> years ago<a3_0/>, and after this was replaced only gradually with the spread of the <a4_0><b8_0>Neolithic<b8_0/> Revolution<a4_0/>.
